Biography

From an early age, I have been passionate about electronics design and research, successfully creating an electronic boat entirely by hand during middle school. Throughout my undergraduate studies, I won numerous national and provincial awards, including a national award in Mathematical Modeling and the National Computer Design Competition, provincial awards in the Liaoning Provincial Computer Design Competition for three consecutive years, provincial awards in the TI Cup Electronic Design Competition and Physics Competition. In 2020, I earned a provincial award in the Innovation, Creativity, and Entrepreneurship Challenge, along with the Best Innovation and Best Creativity awards (only two recipients university-wide).

During my undergraduate period, I led one provincial-level project, participated in three advisor-led projects, and secured three patents. My primary responsibilities included embedded system design, research on wireless sensing algorithms, and IoT system construction. In recognition of academic excellence, I received the China Aerospace CASC Scholarship in 2021 (only 24 recipients university-wide). From 2020 to 2022, I earned the Special-Class Scholarship twice (only 17 recipients campus-wide), received the Technology Academic Scholarship for three consecutive years, and consistently achieved the outstanding student recognition. In 2022, I was recognized for one of the best graduation projects at the university and named an Outstanding Graduate of Liaoning Province.

Regarding practical experience, I served as an intern in embedded development and 5G base station maintenance in 2020. By the end of 2022, I received employment offers from prestigious institutions such as the TianJi Team at Tsinghua University's Center for Brain-inspired Computing Research, Datang Telecom, and the Space Application Center of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (the only fresh undergraduate selected). Ultimately, I joined the Chinese Academy of Sciences, focusing on GNSS onboard receiver development and participating in major projects including DRO orbital satellites and the SMILE mission (China-Europe collaboration).

From 2023 to 2025, I pursued a Master's degree in Wireless Communications at Lund University in Sweden, specializing in wireless channels, channel coding, machine learning, and MIMO technologies.
